Salvage.definition: compensation paid for saving a ship or its cargo from the perils of the sea or for recovering it from an actual loss

1 a.definition: compensation paid for saving a ship or its cargo from the perils of the sea or for recovering it from an actual loss (as in a shipwreck)

sub_terms.b: the act of saving or rescuing a ship or its cargo
sub_terms.c: the act of saving or rescuing property in danger (as from fire)

2 a.definition: property saved from destruction (as in a wreck or fire)

sub_terms.b: damaged property acquired by an insurer after payment for the loss compare
